application.doc: OAuth configuration for a reverse proxy instance

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

param.name: id
param.doc: Name of the instance to act on, which is a unique name that identifies the instance

method.name: POST
method.id: OAuth configuration for a reverse proxy instance
method.doc: This RESTful web service is used to add protocol specific configuration to an existing reverse proxy instance for a given OAuth Definition. The reverse proxy configuration file is modified, a new junction (Default is /mga) is configured, ACLs are created and attached, and the Advanced Access Control runtime server SSL certificate is optionally loaded into the relevant keystore.
The HTTP-Tag-Value attribute will be added to the /mga junction object to propagate the user_session_id to the OAuth runtime.

The Advanced Access Control runtime server SSL certificate is loaded into the keystore configured in the reverse proxy configuration file. The keystore is either the value of the jct-cert-keyfile entry in the junction stanza or if that entry is not set, the value of the webseal-cert-keyfile entry in the ssl stanza.

The following configuration entry and object space changes will be made; after the API is invoked the log file will contain all changes too:
[server] http-method-disabled-remote = TRACE,CONNECT [eai] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for browser interaction. eai-auth = https retain-eai-session = yes eai-redir-url-priority = yes [eai-trigger-urls] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for browser interaction. trigger = /mga/sps/oauth/oauth20/session* trigger = /mga/sps/auth* trigger = /mga/sps/authservice/authentication* [azn-decision-info] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for API protection HTTP_HOST_HDR = header:host HTTP_REQUEST_SCHEME = scheme HTTP_REQUEST_METHOD = method HTTP_REQUEST_URI = uri HTTP_AZN_HDR = header:authorization HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE_HDR = header:content-type HTTP_TRANSFER_ENCODING_HDR = header:transfer-encoding [oauth] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for API protection oauth-auth = https default-fed-id = https://localhost/sps/oauth/oauth20 fed-id-param = FederationId cluster-name = oauth-cluster user-identity-attribute = username continue-on-auth-failure = true [tfim-cluster:oauth-cluster] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for API protection handle-pool-size = 10 handle-idle-timeout = 240 timeout = 240 server = 9,https://127.0.0.1:443/TrustServerWS/SecurityTokenServiceWST13 basic-auth-user = easuser basic-auth-passwd = #### ssl-keyfile = pdsrv.p12 ssl-keyfile-stash = pdsrv.sth [session] require-mpa = no user-session-ids = yes [session-http-headers] Authorization = https [forms] # Changes to this stanza are only made if configured for API protection and not browser interaction. forms-auth = none Object space changes server task default-webseald-isam create -t ssl -h 127.0.0.1 -p 443 -b ignore -c all -j -J inhead -k -r -e utf8_uri -f -q description OAuth_Auto_Configuration acl modify isam_oauth_anyauth set group iv-admin TcmdbsvaBRrxl acl modify isam_oauth_anyauth set any-other Tr acl modify isam_oauth_anyauth set unauth T acl create modify isam_oauth_nobody set unauth T acl create isam_oauth_rest acl modify isam_oauth_rest description OAuth_Auto_Configuration acl modify isam_oauth_rest set group iv-admin TcmdbsvaBRrxl acl modify isam_oauth_rest set any-other Tmdr acl modify isam_oauth_rest set unauth T acl create isam_oauth_rest_unauth acl modify isam_oauth_rest_unauth description MMFA_Auto_Configuration acl modify modify isam_oauth_unauth description OAuth_Auto_Configuration acl modify isam_oauth_unauth set group iv-admin TcmdbsvaBRrxl acl modify isam_oauth_unauth set any-other Tr acl modify isam_oauth_unauth set unauth Tr acl attach /WebSEAL/isam-default/mga isam_oauth_nobody acl attach /WebSEAL/isam-default/mga/sps/auth isam_oauth_anyauth acl attach /WebSEAL/isam-default/mga/sps/common/qr request.doc:
POST https://{appliance_hostname}/wga/reverseproxy/{instance_id}/oauth_config
POST_DATA: { "hostname":"127.0.0.1", "port":"443", "username":"easuser", "password":"passw0rd", "browser":true, "api":true, "junction":"/mga" }
cURL example:
curl -vv -k --user admin:xxxxx -H 'Accept: application/json' -H 'Content-type: application/json' https://isam.host/wga/reverseproxy/default/oauth_config -d ' { "hostname":"127.0.0.1", "port":"443", "username":"easuser", "password":"passw0rd", "browser":true, "api":true, "junction":"/mga" }'

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: hostname
param.doc: The hostname of the runtime.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port of the runtime. Must be the SSL port.

param.name: username
param.doc: The username used to authenticate with the runtime.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password used to authenticate with the runtime.

param.name: reuse_certs
param.doc: If the SSL certificate has already been saved, this flag indicates that the certificate should be reused instead of overwritten. Default is false.

param.name: reuse_acls
param.doc: A flag to indicate that any existing ACLs with the same name should be reused. If they are not reused, they will be replaced. Default is false .

param.name: api
param.doc: Should this reverse proxy be configured for API protection. Default is false.

param.name: browser
param.doc: Should this reverse proxy be configured for Browser interaction. Default is false.

param.name: auth_register
param.doc: Will the client registration endpoint require authentication. Default is false.

param.name: fapi_compliant
param.doc: Configures reverse proxy instance to be FAPI Compliant. Default is false.

param.name: load_certificate
param.doc: Determines whether the certificate is loaded automatically from the runtime server, or whether it needs to be manually added to the WebSEAL key file. Default is true.

param.name: junction
param.doc: Junction point to create. Default is /mga
